intro: Raphiocarpus sesquifolius, commonly known as the narrow-leaved raphiocarpus, is a species of flowering plant in the family Rubiaceae. It is characterized by its opposite, ovate to lanceolate leaves that are often hairy on the underside. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in clusters, which are typically borne in the axils of the leaves. Its fruits are small, dry, and three-lobed, containing a single seed each. This species is native to tropical and subtropical regions of Asia and is often found in moist, shaded environments.
